greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of partitions of the set {1,2,...,n}, having exactly k blocks consisting only odd entries (0<=k<=ceiling(n/2)).
comment: Row n has 1 + ceiling(n/2) terms. Row sums are the Bell numbers (A000110). T(2n,n) = T(2n+1,n+1) = A000110(n) (the Bell numbers). T(n,0) = A124421(n).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..150, flattened
formula: The generating polynomial of row n is P[n](t)=Q[n](t,1,1), where the polynomials Q[n]=Q[n](t,s,x) are defined by Q[0]=1; Q[n]=t*dQ[n-1]/dt + x*dQ[n-1]/ds + x*dQ[n-1]/dx + t*Q[n-1] if n is odd and Q[n]=x*dQ[n-1]/dt + s*dQ[n-1]/ds + x*dQ[n-1]/dx + s*Q[n-1] if n is even.
maple: Q[0]:=1: for n from 1 to 13 do if n mod 2 = 1 then Q[n]:=expand(t*diff(Q[n-1],t)+x*diff(Q[n-1],s)+x*diff(Q[n-1],x)+t*Q[n-1]) else Q[n]:=expand(x*diff(Q[n-1],t)+s*diff(Q[n-1],s)+x*diff(Q[n-1],x)+s*Q[n-1]) fi od: for n from 0 to 13 do P[n]:=sort(subs({s=1,x=1},Q[n])) od: for n from 0 to 13 do seq(coeff(P[n],t,j),j=0..ceil(n/2)) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
T:= proc(n, k) local g, u; g:= floor(n/2); u:=ceil(n/2);
seq(seq(T(n,k), k=0..ceil(n/2)), n=0..15);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 23 2013
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Module[{g = Floor[n/2], u = Ceiling[n/2]},
Sum[StirlingS2[g, j]*If[u == i, 1, j^(u - i)], {j, 0, g}], {i, k, u}]];
Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, Ceiling[n/2]}], {n, 0, 15}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 20 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_, updated Jan 01 2021 *)
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Oct 31 2006
